Authority.description: The authority to use. Should be the url of the id server.

Scope.description: The primary scope for this app.

DisplayName.description: The display name for this application, will be used for the id server metadata.

AdditionalScopes.description:
Any additional scopes that this app should request for user tokens. This will allow
those user tokens to be flowed to those additional apps.

ClientCredentialsScopes.description:
Any scopes that will be used in the client credentials version of the client metadata.
The client credentials are how this applicaiton can log into other services to get their
data. Those services should be listed here so they are included in the application's jwt
that id server creates. This is used when the applicaiton needs to login to a service directly
and cannot just send the user's token along.

ClientSecret.description:
The client secret for this app. This can be null to have no secret. It defaults to
"notyetdefined". Ideally this should be set to something.

ClientConfig.title: ClientConfig
ClientConfig.description:
Settings specific to the AppDashboard application. Don't put secret info
in here as it is sent to the client also.

IdentityServerHost.description: The base url of the identity service to modify.

PathBase.description:
The Path Base for the url. The path base url written here will be forced by the
UrlFix middleware, it will also be used as the cookie path.

UseAssetBundles.description: Set this to true to use asset bundles instead of individual client side files.

CertManager.title: CertManagerOptions
CertManager.description: Options for the system certficiate manager.

LoadCerts.description: Set this to true (default) to load the certificates using Process.Start with FileName.

FileName.description: The file name of the process to load to update certificates.

IdServerHost.description: The host for the identity server providing tokens.

ClientId.description: The client id to login with.

ClientSecret.description: The secret for the client id.

Scope.description: The scope that will be accessed.

ExpirationTimeFraction.description:
This represents the fraction of the total lifetime of the access token to keep using it until
it should be refreshed. It should be between 0 and 1, the default is 0.8 (use token for 80% of the total time, then refresh)

SharedClientCredentials.title: SharedClientCredentials
SharedClientCredentials.description: Client credentials settings that can be shared.

IdServerHost.description: The host for the identity server providing tokens.

ClientId.description: The client id to login with.

ClientSecret.description: The secret for the client id.
